item.title: friends
item.description:
the little imprints
left on the web
i see myself
on the surface of their skin
it honestly makes me
tear up in public

the little imprints
they honestly make me
want to do more
and write better

i wrote a letter yesterday
and used ancient texting
to send it across the street

this is a crazy place
i am a crazy place
only sometimes
but it’s okay to be crazy

sometimes

item.title: sharing music
item.description:
i inked in faded words on the cut up stickers stuck to the back of my phone, hiding the embarrasing past behind them.

today i looked at the back of my phone, the ink had rubbed off. must be in my pants pocket, or floating around town, all physical information about that night spread out in oxford’s chilly pollution. that’s what time does - delocalizes coherent initial information.

if you can make a dot out who you were at different discrete points, maybe someone can interpolate through, and find you at the end of the graph.

item.title: identity
item.description:
i keep getting told i’m only twenty

guess what i did actually know that

did you know helen got married at nineteen?

you can prove that identical particles cannot be distinguished by their histories. well, why shouldn’t that apply to everything, after all?

item.title: Four Portraits
item.description: these are portraits of four of my friends i met in georgia on an island. elena stole an orange from someone’s yard. she had to work up her courage to do it and came up with all these justifying reasons but turns out the orange wasnt ripe. she tried to eat it anyway but couldnt and threw it away.
